question.body: In order to test the effectiveness of a new drug in reducing cholesterol level, a random sample of 45 patients who have a higher than normal cholesterol level was chosen. The cholesterol level of each of the patients was measured and recorded before and then after taking the new drug for a period of 6 weeks, and the differences (before − after) were calculated. The appropriate set of hypotheses, in this case, is:

multiple_choice.choice: None of the above. This is not a matched pairs situation.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Note that if the drug is effective, we would expect the participants' cholesterol levels to be lower after taking it for 6 weeks. This means that we expect the differences (level before − level after) to be....

Correct. If the drug is effective, we would expect the participants' cholesterol levels to be lower after taking it for 6 weeks. This means that we expect the differences (level before − level after) to be positive, and therefore the appropriate hypotheses in this case are (H0: μd = 0) and (Ha: μd > 0).
